intro: Tillandsia laxa, commonly known as the silver vellum tillandsia, is a species of air plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Bromeliaceae family and is characterized by its dense, velvety foliage that gives it its common name. The plant is epiphytic, meaning it grows on other plants without being parasitic, and it absorbs moisture and nutrients through its leaves. Its rosette-shaped structure helps retain water, and it produces small, white flowers that bloom in the spring. Tillandsia laxa is popular as a decorative plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
